items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea,  over the next two days may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible today, Saturday 8 November, and throughout the weekend.
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Sunday 9 November 2025. or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Deben estuary
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible between 12:15pm and 2:15pm today, Saturday 8 November. 
Tide levels will be high around the boat yard in Felixstowe Ferry hamlet at the end of Ferry Road, and along riverside areas in Woodbridge and Waldringfield, as well as in surrounding marshland. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Harwich of 2.57mAODN at 1:15pm today, Saturday 8 November, which is 0.27m above tide tables, Wind Force 4, Westerly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 08 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Suffolk and Essex coast from Felixstowe to Clacton including Orwell and Stour estuaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: North Sea, River Orwell, River Deben

items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible between 12:15pm and 2:15pm today, Saturday 8 November. 
The flood gates at Felixstowe seafront will be closed. The waterfront at Pin Mill, and The Strand at Wherstead under the Orwell Bridge may be flooded.  Water may be on the quay at Mistley. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Harwich of 2.57mAODN at 1:15pm today, Saturday 8 November, which is 0.27m above tide tables, Wind Force 4, Westerly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 08 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 2:15 PM to 6:15 PM on 08/11/2025. 
The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.72 mAOD at 4:15 PM on 08/11/2025.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. Flooding of properties is not expected.

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is 14 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain steady for the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 8:00PM on 08 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Gribbin Head to Rame Head
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Tidal conditions are expected to improve and no flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
The previous tide of concern has now passed,  the weather is more settled and no flooding is expected. The series or high spring tides has now finished and peak high tide levels are now receding. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: North Sea coast at Skipsea, Hornsea and Mappleton
items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 18:00 to 19:15 on 08/11/2025. 
Locations most affected will be the North Sea coast from Skipsea to Mappleton, including Hornsea. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . There is a risk of overtopping. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 08 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message:
High tides tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 06:30 to 09:30 on 09/11/2025. 
Locations most affected will be properties on the east side of Kilnsea, including Kilnsea Caravan Park, and Easington Caravan Park 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 09 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible between 12:15pm and 2:15pm today, Saturday 8 November. 
Clacton Promenade, Lee-over-Sands and Brightlingsea sea front may see some wave overtopping and spray. The Strood at Mersea Island, Coast Road and car parks on the front at West Mersea, and the Hythe and Promenade at Maldon may be flooded. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Clacton of 2.71mAODN at 1:15pm today, Saturday 8 November, which is 0.12m above tide tables, Wind Force 4, Westerly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 08 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast at Coalhouse Fort
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible between 1:00pm and 3:00pm today, Saturday 8 November. 
Areas most at risk are Coalhouse Fort and car park, and the low lying land between the fort and Coalhouse Point. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Southend of 3.48mAODN at 2:00pm today, Saturday 8 November, which is 0.24m above tide tables, Wind Force 3, Westerly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 08 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Isle of Sheppey and coast from Kemsley to Seasalter
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
High tides on Saturday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible 12:00 midday to 04:00 PM on Saturday 08/11/2025. 
Areas most at risk include low lying land, promenades and coastal footpaths. For those that need it, the forecast peak high water level is 3.46 m AOD at 02:00 PM.

Spring tides remain high but are expected to reduce gradually over the coming days. We do not currently expect there to be a risk of flooding from any subsequent high tides over the coming days. However, we will continue to monitor the forecast and update this Flood Alert message if necessary. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . Please take care because large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 08 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Portsmouth

floodArea.riverOrSea: The Solent, Portsmouth Harbour, Langstone Harbour

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Coastal conditions are expected to improve and no flooding is expected. As tides will remain high until Monday (10/11/25), coastal defence gates will remain closed throughout Old Portsmouth over the weekend. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and work with emergency services and local authorities.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message: The weather forecast is for Saturday morning is light showers, into afternoon there will be a break in the cloud leading to some sunnier spells. River levels and  lakes such as Windermere are falling slowly and will continue to do so over the weekend. We continue to monitor the situation. Do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 9th November 2025.
